packages.title: core
packages.description: A set of language helpers, utility functions, and classes for writing TypeScript applications.  Includes APIs for feature detection, asynchronous and streaming operations, basic event handling, and making HTTP requests.

packages.title: loader
packages.description: A minimal bootstrap for TypeScript and JavaScript libraries that loads modules in AMD, CJS, and eventually ES2015 formats.

packages.title: dom
packages.description: Utilities for DOM manipulation and event handling/delegation in browser runtimes.  It encourages (and shims) standard DOM methods where possible, but it provides utilities to make common and recommended use cases easy and obvious, and harder use cases less painful.

packages.title: routing
packages.description: Base API for managing navigation and history via path based hash changes and the HTML5 History API, and higher level routing management.

packages.title: crypto
packages.description: User-friendly, cross-platform, extensible cryptographic API. Initially includes a set of hashing and signing algorithms to support common use cases like OAuth and AWS request validation. crypto makes working with cryptographic algorithms easier by providing a consistent cross-platform API for accessing native cryptographic functionality.

packages.title: class declaration
packages.description: Utilities for defining class hierarchies, including multiple inheritance.

packages.title: parser
packages.description: A package for processing a DOM into objects.

packages.title: io
packages.description: An API for working with input/ouput (io) operations including filesystem access, sockets, workers, and other APIs as available.

packages.title: dstore
packages.description: Data infrastructure framework providing the tools for modelling and interacting with data collections and objects. Works with a variety of data storage mediums, and provides a consistent interface for accessing data across different user interface components.
